subproject.description:
The Preventive Development programme supports the government’s efforts towards enhancing institutional and community capacities for disaster risk prevention and management and also to support activities geared towards enhanced sustained environmental management. Recognising the acute environmental challenges the country is faced with through natural and man made incidents, UNDP will also build on the existing capacity and ongoing programmes to ad¬dress issues of biodiversity, land management, renewable energy and conservation.  It will ensure that disaster risk management is integrated into general planning processes and more specifically into the Poverty Reduction Strategy policy.  The Preventive Development programme will also support policy and action plans. 
The programme will also be looking at promoting the link between climate change and disaster management since climate change is a source of multiple hazards/disasters that threaten long-term development actions of the Government of Sierra Leone.
subproject.title: Preventive Development Support

subproject.description:
Enhanced capacity for coordination and response 
With the immediate support from TRAC 3, the project will strive to achieve the following in a six month period:

• Expedited joint assessment of damage caused by floods
• Enhanced capacity for conducting emergency needs assessment
• Development of recovery framework in collaboration with other stakeholders
• Development of a national disaster management strategy in the country
subproject.title: Emergency Needs Assessments
